column5: Since I just purchased my first electric trolling motor , I am looking to help it last a while. I came across the following article for newbies to this practice like me  http://www.ontariofishing.net/news/sept2004-2.html  Hope it helps another newbie too.  Splashhopper
Thanks for the link. I like to completely disassemble mine in the winter to clean everything and fix any minor problems that I see.
so far with my luck, I don't need maintenance, i usually bounce them off a dock and replace them
